intro: Oenothera picensis subsp. picensis, commonly known as the Piceño evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats like grasslands and rocky slopes. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Oenothera picensis subsp. picensis is known for its ecological importance in supporting local pollinator populations.
